description: From Latin regredi (“to go back”). Compare regrade, regress.

verbs.description: regrede (third-person singular simple present regredes, present participle regreding, simple past and past participle regreded)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To go back; to retrograde, as the apsis of a planet's orbit.
examples: […]  the instantaneous parabola decreases in magnitude and descends in position throughout the entire motion, while its axis regredes during the ascent and progredes during the descent of the particle.
